intro: Gochnatia buchii var. obovata, commonly known as the Obovate Gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, obovate leaves that are often hairy, providing a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, typical of the genus. This species is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
